snippet: Capt. Amadou Haya Sanogo, who led a coup in March, spoke of a continuing role in public life for the junta, which he called “the committee.”
abstract: Mali's new military junta fights back an attempted countercoup by loyalist troops; victory signals that the junta may be continuing to consolidate its control of the government, despite pledges to restore civilian rule and democracy.
lead_paragraph: Capt. Amadou Haya Sanogo, who led a coup in March, spoke of a continuing role in public life for the junta, which he called “the committee.”

headline.seo: Mali Uprising No Threat to Junta Leader’s Plans
headline.main: Mali Uprising Proves No Threat to Junta Leader’s Vision of Authority
headline.print_headline: Mali Uprising Proves No Threat to Junta Leader’s Vision of Authority

keywords.value: Coups D'Etat and Attempted Coups D'Etat
keywords.name: subject
